description:
When you're craving a lobster roll, you'll do crazy things like go to Fisherman's Wharf voluntarily when you're not hosting out-of-town visitors.  Pretty easy to get to actually since it's right near the F-line turnaround.  A bit of pricey lunch at $30 for a roll, side and soda.  But it was a lot better than I thought it would be.

Lobster Roll (w/ extra lobster): Basically the Connecticut-style lobster roll that I love.  Warm lobster chunks dressed in mainly just butter on a toasted split bun roll.  The portion was fine with the extra lobster option, but the default amount might be too skimpy.  I especially liked the bun since it was fluffy, buttery and crispy all at the same time.  Definitely satisfied my urge.

Mac-'n-Cheese: Was a bit of let down.  Glad I got the side rather than the main course with lobster on top.  The macaroni was way too soggy.  There was no crusty cheese on top.  The cheese sauce was better than Kraft, but wasn't anywhere in my top list for mac & cheese I've had around the city.
author: Adam B.

description:
Food:7/10
We have been wanting to try this place for a little while now. The lobster and crab was very fresh. However it could have been more flavorful. (At least give people options to season themselves. Some Old Bay and some garlic options.) But they were pretty good because they were fresh. That's why the 2 stars.

Customer Service:0/10
They guy was totally lifeless. I just feel like when  running any kind of business you should have someone personable interacting with the customer. He just took the order and made our food. No smiles ...nothing. Like he did not want to be there.

This place is very small in the inside as well. So plan on taking your food to go.


It was good but not worth the pricing in my opinion. Most likely will not return.
author: Jasmine G.

description:
(Sorry for my English in advance.)
It was interesting. I came across this diner and ordered a half lobster and half crab roll. The owner cooked it for me. I was just about to start eating when he asked me to get out of the place (he even stretched out his arm to make that gesture). I was surprised but still complied since although Yelp says the hours is until 9 am, that shows as 8:30 pm on Google). Then the funny part came -- another customer walked in to order, and he started to serve her with the door open and no sign of closing the shop. I held the food on the street in chilly wind, really regretting having paid the 15% tip.
The food was good though, fresh meat on tasty bread. But, I still felt sad about my tip.
author: Hui Y.

description: I do like it's quick and it's not too pricy.  We felt the guy was a bit rude, we were tourists from out of town with some questions about portion sizes and what goes into their special losbster dog vs their regular, and felt dismissed.
author: D L.

description: I will definitely be ordering from here again, but only for delivery. Everything was great - portions of the sides could be a bit larger but overall I'm fat and happy.
author: Brandon M.

description: Small with hardly any space but once you cop a squat with on these crazy delicious seafood masterpieces you forget your surroundings. The seafood was fresh and the combo Mac and cheese was amazing. The bread was toasted with some butter which made a world of difference. The crab and lobster creamy combo begged for another to be ordered. It was the perfect lunch. No forks needed. The day was breezy but warm and the sea air had delightful aroma. Don't pass by this small out of the way spot without grabbing a roll or two!
author: Rafael R.

description: Should have read the  negative review i Yelp first before I went to this restaurant.   After I saw how the person behind the counter mistreated the customer in front of me, I decided to take my business somewhere else. That person behind the counter is the rudest and meanest restaurant employee/owner I have ever seen in my 35 yrs in San Francisco.
author: Ricky D.

description: Let me start with the lobster hails from Maine. The gentleman handling our order was upfront about my questions and also carried a sense of humor about him (very polite and kind). He even offered us some popcorn while we waited (a nice touch - avoid the popcorn if you cannot handle salt). The lobster roll comes in the traditional bread roll. He piled on the lobster pretty well and we were able to enjoy our meal inside, away from the blazing sun !! We both inhaled our rolls (and not because we were starving). They make for a wonderful snack if you're walking around the harbor area and want something simple and quick. $16 a piece but it was definitely cheaper than some of the places I've seen. Definitely will return !!
author: Brittanie W.

description: First time in SF and really wanted to try a Lobster roll in Fisherman's Wharf. Owner/worker was rude and very stand-offish as though he would have rather I not come in the restaurant. He abruptly took my order to which I received the smallest rip off lobster roll for $9!! Literally the size of my thumb. It was like warm, could have been served hotter. Tasted fine BUT not worth the money. Definitely better spots on the wharf with better customer service! See attached picture for thumb size roll.
author: Camille M.

description: This place is the bomb good prices and good food great service.$16 for a lobster roll
author: Tom M.

description:
It's kind of hard to go wrong with seafood & bread. With some of the options (I believe the crab options), you can get mayo + butter. I ordered the half lobster roll, and it only came with butter. I ordered the $9 lobster half roll. It tasted as you expect. The reason I give it a lower rating is because of the bang for buck. 

Nothing in particular stood out at the restaurant. My friends and I collectively ordered the lobster roll, crab & lobster mixed roll, and the mac & cheese. The mac & cheese was peppery, so be warned. 

Taste: 3.5/5 
Bang for buck: 2.5/5
author: Lander L.

description:
Omg! This has become a weekly or bi-monthly obsession that I get for Sunday delivery!  
Tip: always get extra meat on the mac n cheese and rolls.  Worth it!
Plus eating in the comfort of your own home. Mega worth it.
I'll try the chowder once it gets SF cold out here
author: Aletta A.

description: The owner was rude and awkward. The food was far too expensive for it tasting like inside of a shoe.
author: Kenzie L.

description:
It was annoyingly hard to find this place since its location in Google Maps doesn't exactly match where this place is actually located. 

Regardless, I found my way to Crabsters and opted for a half lobster roll. It was pretty small - definitely not enough for a single meal - but it was good. It's a bit pricey at $9 for essentially a few bites. I would get the full roll next time since it's a better value.

Finally, be aware that there isn't anywhere to sit.
author: Daniel A.

description:
I was craving a Lobster roll so my husband and I drove all the way to San Francisco to get one and Crabsters DID NOT disappoint. We both got a regular Lobster Roll with mayo and butter. The roll was so soft and delicious and they don't skimp on how much meat they give you. However, if your feeling extreme.. and like a side of roll with your meat, go extra meat. They give you so much meat it is crazy!!! I want to try the half (lobster) and half (crab) next time. 

The prices were very reasonable for what they give you. And being the germaphobe that I am, I loved how the server handled himself when preparing our sandwiches. He put on fresh gloves in front of us and removed them when touching other stuff. That alone gave him a star. Ntm, he was friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. 

Crabsters, in my opinion, is a takeout type of restaurant. There's a small waiting bar, but that's the extent of the space in there. You order your sandwiches, grab you a bag of chips, something to drink, and head out. I would have loved to sit outside (hint: outside tables, maybe?) and ate, but I took it back to my car and fell in love. I'll definitely be back.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Writing this review before I taste the food negative 50/10 customer service - guy taking your order makes you feel incompetent so don't ask a single question. He's a total jerk- see all below comments.
author: Jayme D.

description: I got the lobster roll and it didn't have enough lobster and it didn't have anything else inside!! Super disappointed
author: Ulana B.

description:
Crabsters is delicious!

I have been here twice already and have gotten the lobster mac-n-cheese both times. It is indeed expensive, but it's worth the price of admission. The lobster meat is fresh and yummy! I have eaten the lobster roll too and it was great. There are no tables or chairs inside the restaurant, so you gotta take your food to-go and enjoy it at the park nearby or find a table close by. 

All prices here include the tax rate already. Steve, the owner, has a sign saying he will not accept pennies, nickels, dimes. ONLY CARDS, BILLS and QUARTERS!.
author: Philip M.

description: Visited this place on 8/18/18 at 5:00 PM. The customer service from the owner was inexcuseable. There was an issue with our order and another customer. When I and the other woman had brought up the issue with him, he absolutely did not want to resolve it. Instead, he proceeded to accuse the woman and I for negligence on our orders! I will never enter that establishment again. Treating his customers so rudely is unacceptable, and I will not recommend this place to anyone; Instead, I will warn others to steer absolutely clear from this place and save your money. There are plenty of restaurants on the pier with a savoring lobster roll.
author: Diego P.

description:
My friend just NEEDED her lobster roll while we were here at the Wharf, just like how I needed my clam chowder bread bowl 

We stopped by this place first to check what it looks like and the prices. It's a small hole in the wall shop that's literally there to just sell food, no real dining area. They had a pretty good range of rolls and food but we decided to check out the rest of the Fishermans Wharf for other choices 

She ended up picking this place again after I got my clam chowder because 1. It looked good in the pictures 2. It was cheaper than the competition 3. They had a half size which was perfect for her appetite 

She really seemed to enjoy her lobster roll and we were able to enjoy our food at their "dine n dash" counter which is literally a small counter top fit for two people to stand and eat their food and leave 

Sounds pretty SF if you ask me
author: Deanne L.

description: I may be a bit of a lobster roll aficionado, but to tell you the truth I was disappointed. The lobster is flown in from Maine but the portion size of the lobster was very meager (even for the $16 price tag). The bun was good but the dearth of lobster made me a little sad. Not really any seating either so more of a grab and go place.
author: Shawn K.

description:
Alert * This review is mostly based on service 

Came in on Sunday, July 23rd, 2017 at 6:30pm (in case the owner cares about their business). After a long day of hiking, my girlfriend and I were famished and excited to get a crab roll. We walked in and there wasn't a single person there except for the guy behind the counter. I walk up and asked if the Dungeness was fresh, and the guy replies "yes". Nothing more, nothing less, just "yes". Befuddled, I say, "How are the lobster?" He then gives me a look of utter disdain and annoyance and says, "Sir, what can I help you with?" I explain to  him that what I order depends on what he tells me about their ingredients. He then rolls his eyes. At this point I'm raging inside but was anticipating getting a crab roll and dammit, I wasn't going to let this guy stop me. 

I ordered a crab roll and my girlfriend ordered the macaroni and cheese mixed with the lobster and crab. Though my crab roll was small, it was not bad. However, just getting back from Seattle the previous week I definitely did not feel it was fresh Dungeness. In all fairness, it could have been that at this point I was so irritated at my experience that it ruined it for me. The macaroni and cheese dish was more or less the same as the crab roll, imo. The macaroni and cheese was better than Kraft, but that's about it. Same story on the crab and lobster meat, didn't think it was fresh.

Service-wise, this was one of the worst experiences, if not THE worse experience, I've ever experienced at a food establishment. I would never come back based on that alone.

** It's also worthy to note that there is absolutely no seating inside or out.
author: Rick C.

description:
Lobster bisque was an airy light blob of pudding consistency with only hints of lobster flavor. Very disappointing even for a tourist trap.

Lobster roll was fine but note it's a tiny roll.
author: Anthony W.

description: After taking a stroll around ghirardelli, we decided to have a quick snack. So, I opened Yelp app and stared browsing. This place had good reviews and looked good for grab and go. We ordered half crab roll and a cup of lobster bisque. Crab roll was good and bisque was creamy and flavorful. It's a tiny shop but they have good options. I would recommend it.
author: Ruchi S.

description: $70 for lobster roll, crab roll and lobster Mac and cheese with extra meat on all. Was it good and worth it? No. It was ok and it doesn't look like I paid extra. Now I wonder how much you get for the regular size. New England lobster in Burlingame is better. Oh and the Mac and cheese ain't all that. I heard a lot of bad reviews on the service but I guess it's our lucky day because the service wasn't bad at all. Would I come back? Only if I'm craving for lobster/crab roll and I'm in the area. Other than that I rather drive out for better rolls at a better price.
author: Christy V.

description: The lobster flatbread and lobster bisque are my favorites here, but the lobster Mac and cheese is amazing and the rolls! They give you so much meat in each dish and it is very yummy and fresh!
author: Tara K.

description:
Came here with the wife and mother in law since every place else was a mad house.  This place is a little bit of a ways from the crowded pier area but has its own shop.

The shop itself is small with no tables, just a counter the guy takes your order at and makes the sandwiches. He has a soda fridge to grab drinks out of and sells crab and lobster rolls in addition to a few other items. Coming from New England on vacation, I wasn't expecting much since I usually get my lobster rolls from a fisherman cooking them up on the dock.

I was surprised when my half & half (half lobster, half crab), was just as good as the ones I've had in some of the best spots in NY and Boston. The prices were a little heavy, but lobster and crab are always pricey.

The wife liked her lobster roll as well, so worth checking out if you want a break from the herd that is thundering around the other shops on the pier.
author: Robert G.

description: Came to Crabsters for a quick bite before a city tour. I figured a small shop like this was likely to be amazing and I was not disappointed! The roll was buttery and crispy and the crab was the most fresh and delicious I've ever had! I am seriously considering coming back after my tour because I am already craving another!!!
author: Emily E.

description: Not sure about the other reviews stating that the owner of this place is rude, but he was really welcoming and friendly when I came here by myself one evening. I was in SF on a business trip and staying at a hotel near fisherman's wharf so I decided to walk around in search of a lobster roll and ventured upon this place so I decided to give it a try. Lobster rolls are pretty pricey but I believe they're all around that price in the area - it was $16 for a full size lobster roll and I think you can pay more for extra meat but I got the regular size one which actually had a pretty good amount of lobster meat. I also ordered the clam chowder & paid $3 extra to add crab meat into it. The owner makes the lobster rolls on the spot and asks you if you prefer mayo or butter or both, but he recommended to have both so that's what I got. It was pretty good; the bread was toasted perfectly and the lobster meat was really good. The clam chowder was pretty good as well especially with the crab meat.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
Ever since I returned from the East Coast and had my first real Lobster Roll, I have been on a search to replicate that delicious experience. However, here in San Francisco I have been continually disappointed until today when I walk into Crabsters. 

The hot butter lobster roll is one of the least expensive and the absolute tastiest that I have had in this area. The lobster is quality-flown in fresh from Maine and you can truly taste the difference. The bread is like buttery crack!  I will come back again and again!
author: David B.

description:
Great crab/lobster rolls. Thoroughly enjoyed it!. 
Close to hotel, just took home and enjoyed.
author: Diana M.

description:
crabsters! crabty time! crabcellent!

party on, lobster.
party on, crab.

order half & half everything f any food decision which doesn't result in you maxing out all options.

skip the dine-in counter and semi-neighboring food court; eat at the shore for the real experience.

(^_^) Half & Half Mac & Cheese $18.5 (http://bit.ly/2qc2wYV)
brings all the seagulls to the yard
kinda italian basil mild spicy ffffn getit

(-_-) Half & Half Roll $16 (http://bit.ly/2qbVcfN)
hegga small #thatswhatshesaid

rltk 4 stars for mac alone except there was a PLASTIC PIECE in it (http://bit.ly/2pI4tbl). mellow shopkeeper tho i'm guessing just honest mistake. thus 3 1/2 overall.
author: Dan B.

description:
Good flavor, lobster was a little tough. 
I got a lobster roll with mayo and butter with extra meat.  I was disappointed with the amount of lobster in it for a $22 sandwich
author: Elyssa M.

description:
Really wanted to love this place. We stopped in randomly after some adventuring with some friends from out of town. The man at the counter was SO nice and helpful. 

We opted for the Crab and Lobster roll with butter. 

The meat was fresh, but we found SO MUCH cartilage and shell in the crab, it was disappointing for us.
author: Meghan L.

description:
My husband and I set out to be TOURISTs  for the day in SF. We do this once a year and hang out at the Wharf. I researched on YELP this new spot and we decided to go there instead of the New England Lobster Market and Eatery. 

We ordered:

2 Crab and Lobster sandwiches with both mayo and butter - They were delicious - Next time we will do extra lobster. Lobster was very good and fresh.

Mac and Cheese with both crab and lobster - Definitely different and again very fresh. 

Clam Chowder with crab - Very very good. I wish the portion was bigger.

I like the food. Its an eat and go location no where to sit. Secondly no where to park like every other location down at the Wharf.  

I deducted a star because I handed the owner my $68 in his hand and he placed my .50 change on the counter. You don't get 5 stars from me when you do that. 

Good food and worth the experience.
author: Chryl R.

description: Had the lobster flat bread, lobster roll (warm) and clam chowder. Everything was phenomenal! Must try!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
I like this place because it is locally owned in an area full of "big box" restaurants. The food is good quick, and the Mac and Cheese with lobster is really delicious. 

My one complaint is the price. I know it's a new business and the man who owns it is very friendly, but the surcharge for crab, when the crab portion is so small, is pretty steep.
author: Jessica D.

description: This place is great! I ordered a crab roll and it was so good I went the next day and brought 5 friends. The whole group loved the crab and lobster rolls!
author: Mary M.

description:
This is a tiny little place across the street from Cioppino's on Fisherman's Wharf. And to match the size of the shop, you get tiny little portions.  A whole roll is $16, which isn't bad in itself I guess if the roll was actually stuffed to the brim, but the meat you get only barely fills the very edge of the bread. You mostly just get bread.  Don't get me wrong the bread itself is fantastic. It's buttery toasted and crisp but we came here for the seafood. And you just don't get much. We ordered the half lobster and half crab and cut in half. He asked if we wanted butter and mayo and we said yes. I did not taste any butter or mayo on my lobster half, only tasted the butter on the bread.   My half was the lobster half and there were only a few pieces of actual lobster, it was fresh and really good lobster so the quality is there, just not the quantity (or the butter or mayo we asked for).   I've definitely had lobster rolls that left me satisfied in the lobster to bread ratio for the same price.  
The cheesecake there is good though.
author: Adelio L.

description: Was at Crabsters and was a delicious Salad with Fish/Lobster. Liked the small restaurant the owner is super clean and looks that everything is fine. Compared to other Restaurants in the surrounding you look the chef over the shoulder.
author: Markus Z.

description:
Was on a family trip to SF recently. We had a long day and wanted some seafood, and my mom wanted a lobster roll due to seeing one earlier near the pier. We weren't hungry at the time so decided to to have it. Glad we waited and tried out crabsters as it was close by where we were staying too. 
I didn't get the lobster roll, but my mom ate it in about 5 seconds, so didn't have chance to even ask to try it. So I will assume that she thought it was spectacular. I ordered a crab salad. I really enjoyed it. It was light and refreshing and fresh. The dressing was nice and was a good amount. 
That owner is super friendly and I hope all the best to him, and that many people stop by. It's near a bobacha tea spot and In-N-Out burger. It's best for take out, watching a movie or having a picnic.
author: Rachel G.

description: DO NOT order delivery from these fraudulent people.  They stole our money and never gave us out food! We spent $90+ and they took our order and just closed up. We called twice and got yelled at and hung up on both times without explanation of why they never delivered our order? We had to call the bank and grub hub to get our money back because they would not help us or give us our food or money back! Bad service !
author: Carley L.

description: I bought a 1/2 lobster 1/2 crab roll with the mayo on the side for my husband and I.  It was so delicious.  The seafood was so fresh and the roll was stuffed with meat.  My son loved the clam chowder.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Food is great, but the guy that works here has a power complex and is unnecessarily rude. While we were waiting in line he abrasively snapped at another customer for standing too close to "his counter," kicking the customer out when he asked to be spoken to with more respect.

Not sure why he thinks its ok to treat people so disrespectfully, but it was uncomfortable and made me not want to come back despite how good the lobster was. People like that don't deserve my money. 

2 stars because the food was good or else it would be a 1 for me.
author: Kyle J.

description:
Our family was looking for a quick lunch spot near the wharf and found this through Yelp. Food was excellent and no complaints! No line. This is a hidden gem.

Gave it 4 stars because the guy working the place was a bit rude. We walked out the first time, in fact. Came back in spite of him.
author: Matt L.

description:
Lobster rolls in your living room! We've ordered Crabsters at least 10 times since discovering them. I recommend using Postmates rather than Grubhub. Grubhub's menu pricing is incorrect. The charge for extra meat on the half lobster/half crab is too high and you can't order plain clam chowder. [Edit 7/5/17: Postmate's menu now has problems as well. You can't order plain lobster bisque or any muffin.]

Crabster's lobster roll has a lot of tail meat. I think it's a better value than Woodhouse or Anchor & Hope, although I prefer the taste of those rolls. Crabster's meat is occasionally chewy and the roll itself just barely holds up. I usually get mine with mayo, but it's been undetectable on all but one order. I add more mayo at home, plus green onions or chives if I have any.

Their clam chowder is delicious, with lots of clams and great bacon flavor. I do wish it had a stronger seafood taste. I don't like the tomato-basil mix they add to their hotdog and mac, but can see it being a good complement to the seafood.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This is a new little shop getting close to six months in operation. The menu is almost exclusively lobster and crab, with a notable inclusion of mac and cheese with lobster and crab. The prices are reasonable for quality fish and the portions are reasonable if not quite really large. 
The flavor was excellent and the bread was fresh and tasty. The guy working there must be the owner. My guess is he is more quality food and not a salesman. We almost left the area when we noticed there was no seating and complained. As we were leaving, we saw a sign indicating seating around the back. We asked about it and he provided directions. 
When we started talking about our order, he was helpful and engaging. He recommended an appropriate sandwich for us and it was very, very good! 
The common-area seating is comfortable and unshaded, but certainly sufficient.
My wife and I really appreciated a great lobster and crab sandwich without breaking the bank!
author: Jeff K.

description: Delicious lobster roll, though a little pricy for JUST the roll without any sides. ($16) Still good though!!!
author: Victoria H.

description:
Honestly this place is a hidden gem. For some odd reason tourist just don't walk in this area and stay on a straight path causing them to miss this place. 

So my family and I walk in and notice that its empty and I start to wonder if its any good. I mean why isn't anyone else in here?! We order anyways..getting a lobster roll with butter and mayo as well as a cup of clam chowder. The man who works there was super friendly and def does not cheat you of any lobster. So we get out food and we are amazed at how much lobster he put in! Usually places out here in Vegas will put something like celery to fill the sandwich in. Flavor wise it was really good! &the clam chowder was delish! Def would recommend this place to anyone looking for some good food!
author: Jamie C.

description: Outstanding!!!  I found this place while traveling on business and had a craving for some fresh clam chowder and a lobster roll... AMAZING!  Going back again today to get another fix!
author: Michael R.

description:
Being a lover of lobster rolls I will have to say I don't know if the food here is good or bad because I was unable to get by the unsanitary manner in which the food was being prepared. However, after giving him (the owner) an opportunity to correct the issue, he clearly made it evident that he did not favor "us" eating there. In fact he stated "you people should be happy I'm giving you a break, by letting you eat something this good." The racism displayed after this was nothing short of a documentary from the civil rights movement. After he refused to change his gloves that he wore while he did other things while prepping our food, I kindly requested my money back. He refused to do so and continued to disrespect my fiancé and I hoping to get a rise, to which we didn't oblige. I will strongly encourage anyone with a Since a moral character to refrain from eating at this restaurant. If you are a person who believes that people should be judge on the content of their character and not the color of their skin, then this is NOT a place you should support. It's sad to see a person with such a vile attitude and hateful  heart in 2018. 

To see the video of this encounter please search hashtags #RacismAtCrabsters #NoMore2800Leavonworth #RacistSanFranCrabstersOwner  all social media outlets.
author: Mr S.

description:
I was feeling like a lobster roll and decided to check out Crabsters. We came on a Thursday evening around dinner time. The shop is super tiny and barebones - there isn't any seating available. 

All lobster rolls anywhere in SF are expensive, but I feel like this one in particular was small and overpriced. The guy working in the back literally opened a pre-packed, pre-cooked ziplock bag of lobster, dumped it onto a bread roll, and then heated it up on the grill.  It tasted fine, but still weird to see the guy prepare it from a ziplock bag then charge me $22 for it. It wasn't worth the money.
author: Mary N.

description: Just a warning, my mum and I got food poisoning from this place. We had the lobster and crab roll and Mac n cheese. The crab we ate had no taste, it must've been off. Take caution when eating here!
author: Brendon O.

description: Stopped in tonight...extremely hot inside. I have to say it was the worst lobster roll I have ever had. It was literally cut up lobster on a bun. I was given the choice of butter or seasoned mayonnaise and said I wanted the mayonnaise. Also witnessed the owner being very rude to 2 differemt customers..one was after she left.  I would not recommend. Also nowhere to sit...and 2.75 for a can of soda. Ridiculous.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The food here is decent but I feel like everything is way overpriced. I only ordered a crab roll and a crab hot dog and my total was almost 40 dollars. That's just those two things, not including drinks or any sides by the way. The food wasn't bad by any means but I wish the prices were indicated more clearly. It almost feels like it was done on purpose to sort of "trick" customers into ordering and then springing the total on them once the order is already placed which kind of rubbed me the wrong way.

I'm giving the place two stars because the food was okay but I definitely think you can find better options considering there's so many seafood options around the area. Don't think I'll ever come back here again.
author: Daniela A.

description: Steve is phenomenal! He loves what he does and excels at it. We stopped in for a quick bite to eat and were blown away. He makes his food from scratch and most definitely knows what he's doing. I ordered the crab mac n cheese and the Lobster/Crab roll. O...M...G delicious! My tastebuds were dancing!! Eat here, you will not be disappointed. :)
author: Holly N.

description: Delicious. Order the lobster roll with extra meat which is about $3 more at $22 and request both butter and mayonnaise.
author: N A.

description: Guy working behind the counter (Aug 4, Fri @noon) was uninviting and rude, after conversing for only 10 sec i've had enough and left for some codmother fish and chips (only 3 min walk away) - best decision i've made all week.
author: Joyce D.

description: The Mixed Lobster & Crab Mac N Cheese sounded delicious and it was!  Pricey but very good.  I'd recommend.
author: Ryan R.

description: It was my first time at Crabsters, and it would definitely be my last. I have been to numerous places in this area and have had many seafood dishes from different places but this one really did not stand out to me. The owner from the start was very unpleasant and at some point it felt like I was not welcome there. The food was not that great either. We had a quick lunch but it turned out to be a regret. We had the lobster mac and cheese and I can honestly say that I probably make this better at home. It was bland, and the lobster was a little chewy. I am not even sure how that happened, but I definitely will not be returning here again.
author: Jessica G.

description: This hole in the wall is by far the best lobster roll we have ever tasted! My eyes are about to pop out with every bite. Just plain simple goodness! Need I say more? Go ahead check out this place and you won't regret it! We will be back!
author: James B.

description: I simply asked the person working if the lobster was warm or cold water lobster. He said in a very annoyed and snarky tone, "what do you mean, its Maine lobster, it's the best in the world. I don't know what else to tell you". I said, "oh, sorry". I should have replied that is not how you treat customers. I was only asking, call it ignorance on my part. I read about the food hype, so I still ordered the lobster mac, even though he treated me like dirt. The mac was tasty, but came from a plastic bag. Not impressed.
author: Ashley W.

description: I went to Crabster, for the first time ever with a few friends and the experience was somewhat good but not great. The lobster mac and cheese and the crab and lobster roll were probably the only highlight of the trip to Crabster. It wasn't perfect but it had potential of being a great meal. The ingredients used in it was not as fresh as I would have expected, and the quality could have been better. It's a huge disappointment that there were no seating areas either and this was a huge turnoff for me. Of course we had to make do with what we had but in the end this was not a very pleasing experience.
author: Federick H.

description: Loved their lobster role. The bun was perfectly crisp and golden brown. The meat was tender and delicious. Hand down one of the best roll in the area!!
author: Nandita C.

description:
Had the crab/lobster mixed roll and clam chowder - simple but lovely.
Would go again if ever in San Francisco
author: Kerry H.

description: So for almost $40.00 for two lobster rolls, you get a dirty prep cook who uses the same gloves for breaking down boxes and taking orders for customers.   I don't know why this place rated a 4 1/2 stars, it was dead! Not a single person wanted to eat there!  STAY AWAY! The food was not worth the money!!!
author: Matthew C.

description: Definitely the best spot to get a crab sandwich! Looked all over and crabsters had exactly what my family and I were looking for. A little on the pricey side but that's expected for the area.
author: Clayton A.

description: This is definitely a hidden gem.  We were full but when we saw this place we really wanted to try the crab sandwich.  It was amazing.  So much meat and the bread was warm and soft.  Definitely coming back with an empty stomach next time.  So good and cheap!
author: Josephine T.

description: The guy working truly has a power complex. He was rude as hell when I asked how big the half rolls are. What I got wasn't what I expected. The lobster was mediocre and it was all thrown onto a basic and tiny hot dog bun that was lightly toasted, all for $16, totally not worth it. Even the glass soda bottles were $4.
author: Sergey A.

description: great service and excellent crab/lobster roll.  I prefer to eat here rather than waiting around outside in the heat.
author: JOhn P.

description: I have been to many seafood places in this area but Crabster has become one of my favorites. Their crab and lobster roll definitely stands out as being one of their better meals and I can see myself having this often. Lunch at this place can be a little tricky, there is no seating area, so you basically purchase and leave. That isn't too bad as they have great food and the staff is inviting. Oh, although I have had better in other places, I at least appreciate that I do not have to wait in long lines for lunch. I will definitely be visiting again soon.
author: Wayman J.

description: Wow, great crab and lobster rolls with warm meat on a wonderful buttered bun. The guy working there was friendly and although small the place was neat and clean. Honestly some of the best food we had while in the bay area. We would gladly return.
author: Cindy K.

description: I'm from New England and this is about as good as it gets 3000 miles away! No seating so get it to go!
author: Heather G.

description: Took my family of 5 here for a quick bite to eat and we ate for under 50 bucks. The service was fast, super friendly and helpful in assisting me with what to order.  All the food was really good!  My son who is super picky ate his entire lobster roll with mayo AND butter! In a town were everything is overpriced,  this place is a gem!
author: Jerami S.

description:
Rude service. Don't go here. 

The lobster comes from Maine

The owner is very unfriendly

Food was just okay
author: Sam A.

description: Really good lobster and crab, and the Mac and cheese is pretty great too! The mac and cheese has a bit of Cajun seasoning and fresh herbs for flavor. A bit pricey but fair given the area and the quality of the sea food. Seems pretty new so hope this spot does well.
author: Yale S.

description: My family and I really enjoyed the lobster rolls. The buns were beautifully buttered and toasted and the lobster was chunky and fresh. We loved it so much we ended up getting the clam chowder too. Top up dungeness crab meat if you can - woahhh that loaded clam chowder was worth every calorie! Lobster bisque was not so satisfying though so a star off for that.
author: Lydz C.

description:
The seafood is nothing to write home about. Bread is good though. Not worth the price tag.

The main reason for my review is how he treats customers (see other reviews on here). I made my order and waited on my phone for my order to be ready.  Other customers come in, make their orders, and leave with them before I get mine which struck me as odd.  A few more minutes pass and I finally get my order, which I didn't mind.  But then he  comments to me that the other customers took my original order and that I shouldn't have been a zombie on my phone. Okay guy. So the customer is the one solely responsible to intercept their orders in  time? Lol yeah this guys pretty rude, and food is meh for the price.
author: Larry W.

description: I ordered the lobster roll and it was an actual bomb of sweet lobster goodness directly into my mouth. From the small size of the restaurant I was concerned the quality of the lobster would be poor, however I was happily surprised to taste super fresh and delicious lobster in a buttery brioche roll. Delightful!
author: Manuel L.

description: We got a crab/lobster mix roll and clam chowder. For $30, you don't get much meat, but if you're looking for a light bite, this place isn't bad! Clam chowder was decent, im used to boudins which I eat every month at my current place of work. Overall, not bad--but quite small portions for average food.
author: Priya C.

description: Great clam chowder! The actual restaurant does not have seating so be aware of this. Everyone eats their clam chowder walking around the Wharf so not a big deal.
author: Amanda A.

description: Recently, their buns have gotten significantly smaller meaning less meat but the price stayed the same. What a rip off. Not only are the rolls smaller, but they do not taste nearly as good as before. Never again will I come here again.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Lobster roll with mayo and butter was tasty good. Fiance likes her rolls warm so finding this place was a plus. Clam chowder had just the right amount of thickness though it could have had more clam bits. I devoured it nonetheless. FYI, any leftover toast dipped in the clam chowder is a winner.
author: Richman L.

description: It was good but the portion was tiny. For a few extra dollars you can get twice the size anywhere else
author: Dulce O.

description: Small roll with a lite portion of lobster. Poor value. Taste is okay. Definitely a tourist trap. Feeling diners remorse.
author: Alan R.

description: My family is from Maine and these are legit no frills New England style lobster (or crab) rolls. Really good amount of crab or lobster and perfectly toasted new England style buns. Go drawn butter. Mac n cheese was average, not bad, hits the spot if you in mood for Mac.
author: auclair k.

description: fucking rude service. what the fuck! ive never been treated with so much disrespect. so fucking unbelievable. and you charge so much for a tiny piece of lobster roll? scam
author: Angelo P.

description: Simple but very tasty crab and lobster roll. Great for pickup and take home or walk on pier.
author: Don D.

description: The food is AMAZING! The quality of the seafood is top notch. The buns? Best buns ever, with the perfect amount of butter. As to the service, it's been a while I received such great service from a restaurant in a big city. How often do you get to talk to the owner of the shop? The gentleman is so friendly, and you can tell he takes great pride in making the food. Too bad I'm a tourist. I wish I could eat this all the time!
author: Christine L.

description: I visited Crabster a few months ago and I was absolutely blown away. For some reason the store was empty when I walked in, but as soon as I got a whiff of what was cooking inside I knew I would be hooked. The owner was working behind the counter and he could not have been more accommodating. He took the time to chat with my friend and I about the specials and even agreed to take a photo with us! I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for some great crab and lobster at a cost that won't break the bank.
author: Billy S.

description: FRESHEST lobster roll ever! The only establishment in all of Fisherman's Wharf that offered REAL fresh fish meat. Every other shack offered frozen lobster at a very high prize and Crabster's offers fresh lobster at a very reasonable prize. Steve, the owner, was very thoughtful and he definitely aims to please his customers. If you want to eat a good lobster or crab roll, go straight here!!! Don't fall for any other shack that's definitely a Turist trap. Crabster's even offers you a special artisan bread for its rolls! Hands down, best place to go on Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Carolina B.

description: Truly enjoyed the half crab, half lobster roll and the clam chowder with lobster.  I can't wait to go back. Delicious
author: Lizette R.

description: The worst service I have ever experienced. The roll is super small as well. The guy working there has an attitude like he is getting fired soon.
author: May L.

description: The lobster & crab roll was scrumptious and priced well. The owner was very nice and did it all from taking the orders to preparing the food. The wait was not long though & will definitely be back.
author: Roly H.

description: Steve was incredibly patient and attentive, despite the unusually hot San Francisco weather that can easily make anyone nasty and rude. I ordered the lobster roll and for $16, I thought it beat anywhere else in the wharf (other places charge $21). The lobster was fresh and definitely hit the spot. I'll be back! Thanks Steve!
author: Jenn H.

description:
Do yourself a favor, grab a half and half (crab and lobster) roll. You'll thank yourself! 

If you want a cocktail with dinner bring your food The Rock on the corner. Sweet. 

Staff friendly and knowledgeable.
-----

OK, Ken M here with a confession. I took a nibble right outside the shop and OMG! Ate it standing on the corner and never made it to The Rock. As a transplant to the west (who loves SF seafood) somehow this was as good or better than anything I've had in Maine or the rest of New England!
author: K M.

description: Great lobster rolls and surf and turf lobster hotdogs. Very authentic with fresh lobster and New England style split hot dog buns. Great price and service as well. Love this place and recommend it highly!! If I could give it 6 stars I would!!
author: Jonathan R.

description: Beware! The mac and cheese is very spicy! Does not say anywhere that it is not traditional mac and cheese. Ordered thru Postmates and unable to eat due to allergies . Luckily I just got a side of mac and cheese. Had the half and half roll very tasty.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: We ordered the lobster mac and cheese, half crab and half lobster roll and the clam chowder. Everything was delicious! Portions were small but worth the money. We didn't have to wait. It was a little tricky to find. It was located near In & Out Burger.
author: Victoria S.

description: I work in the area.... Hands down best lobster and crab roll I've ever had. Steve the owner is really sweet and down to earth and aims to please his customers. I have 1 at least once a week
author: Bri M.

description: Not pleased, or impressed. Unfortunately I read some good reviews for this place and figured it was worth a shot during our san Fran vaca. Big mistake. First off, there was only one dude there. Also, not super friendly. He took several peoples orders, then turned around to make the orders, pretty much ignoring everyone else in line. I believe the crab and lobster were fresh... but how could I be sure, they were individual portions in little snack bags in a dorm sized mini fridge. The mac n cheese is just in a giant bag, from a food company, not house made. The guy must have answered the phone 10 times while making the orders, definitely making take much longer to put meat on bread. I tried to order the half/half roll, it's on the menu, but the guy said I couldn't order it because the ration of bread to meat would be off. Really? Ok, full half crab, half lobster roll with mayo and butter. My husband got the mac n cheese lobster roll. My son got the clam chowder with crab, and we ordered a side of mac n cheese for our 2 yr old. Two bottles of water for 2.50 each. We waited as he took orders for several other people, while also still answering the phone. Finally he started to make our food, still stopping to answer the phone. He forgot the mayo on mine, and honestly, the crab and lobster taste just as bland as I imagine the plastic bag would taste if I had eaten that. I asked where the outside seating was, in which he replied 'in the center of the building'. No help with which direction to head. Of course there was no availble seating. Way too much bread for how much meat you get. My husband ate his and said it was ok, our son only took a few bites of his chowder before turning up his nose. Our toddler pretty much spit out her mac n cheese. After tasting it I knew why.... It's so peppery, you'll choke. It ended up in the trash too. Pretty much a big waste of money, bad service and nothing near what they advertise. After walking on the pier, we realize we should have just waited in line to get something from the crabstands as at least you can see what you're paying for before you pay.  Maybe they could do a better job if they hired more than one person to do 3 peoples jobs. But then again, the food is what makes a restaurant, and this food was no good. Lesson learned.
author: Crimson T.

description: Was looking for a lobster roll and found a delicious one at Crabsters. Tiny little place, but there is courtyard seating in the back. The owner got my roll going quickly. It was fresh and tasty! Another reviewer said it was pricey, however I disagree. I had a full roll for $16 I've never had a full roll anywhere, either East or West coast that was under $18. Definitely worth finding
author: Marie B.

description: This was good but not great. With how many restaurants there are, it's more worth it to go check somewhere else out because this is not going to be that great of an experience. Got the clam chowder and mixed roll and everything was pretty bland. The best thing was the crab roll, but for how much I spent I would have rather sat down at a nice restaurant because it cost about the same. I would probably do that if I was in the area again.
author: Kelsey L.

description: Fresh crab meat for a great tasting sandwich but the portion is a bit too small for its price.  I'd recommend the owner deviates from the traditional bun to something with more substance to make the crab sandwich worth the $$.
author: Helen C.

description: Be aware do not go to this place it's the biggest ripoff. The lobster roll very small not worth what we paid for.
author: Sara Z.

description: Fresh, authentic, delicious lobster rolls, from the bun to the butter or mayo or both, you would never guess from the outside i recommend it for take out, we were lucky to find this place, Steve the owner is a great guy
author: Omar P.

description: This place was amazing! I was afraid the crab and lobster would be too salty from other seafood places I've been to, but it was just right. And the bread was so good and buttery. I wish the portions were a little bigger though. I definitely recommend this place.
author: ann a.

description: Quick and easy...in and out with a great crab/lobster roll.  Really liked the toasted bun!
author: Jeff S.

description: Delicious lobster bisque and I liked the combined lobster and crab roll. Quick service - healthy and tasty fast food can't be beat!
author: Russell C.

description: Perfect sandwich!  Just lobster, butter, and bread.  Exactly the same as the ones I've had in Boston.  Owner is great and friendly!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Don't be skeptical. Walk in. This place has a great lobster roll!!! Got mine with butter & a lil mayo. The lobster is fresh Maine lobster that is so sweet--no frozen stuff here. I inhaled it, It was soooo good. Definitely will make the dreaded trek to touristy fisherman's wharf for this. My friend had the lobster Mac n cheese.  She said it was delicious.
author: Niki S.
